query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 Quando ambedue li figli di Latona, 2 coperti del Montone e de la Libra, 3 fanno de l’orizzonte insieme zona,
4 quant’ è dal punto che ’l cenìt inlibra 5 infin che l’uno e l’altro da quel cinto, 6 cambiando l’emisperio, si dilibra,
7 tanto, col volto di riso dipinto, 8 si tacque Bëatrice, riguardando 9 fiso nel punto che m’avëa vinto.
query.result:
1 When both the children of Latona, 2 covered by the Ram and the Scales, 3 make a zone of the horizon together,
4 however much from the point that the zenith balances 5 until the one and the other from that girdle, 6 changing the hemisphere, become unbound,
7 so much, with a face painted with laughter, 8 Beatrice was silent, looking 9 fixedly at the point that had overcome me.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
10 Poi cominciò: «Io dico, e non dimando, 11 quel che tu vuoli udir, perch’ io l’ho visto 12 là ’ve s’appunta ogne ubi e ogne quando.
query.result: 10 Then she began: “I say, and do not ask, 11 what you want to hear, because I have seen it 12 there where every where and every when is pointed.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
13 Non per aver a sé di bene acquisto, 14 ch’esser non può, ma perché suo splendore 15 potesse, risplendendo, dir “Subsisto”,
16 in sua etternità di tempo fore, 17 fuor d’ogne altro comprender, come i piacque, 18 s’aperse in nuovi amor l’etterno amore.
query.result:
13 Not to have acquired good for itself, 14 which cannot be, but because its splendor 15 could, shining, say “I subsist,”
16 in its eternity outside of time, 17 outside of every other understanding, as it pleased Him, 18 opened itself in new love, the eternal love.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
19 Né prima quasi torpente si giacque; 20 ché né prima né poscia procedette 21 lo discorrer di Dio sovra quest’ acque.

Please translate each line literally into English.
22 Forma e materia, congiunte e purette, 23 usciro ad esser che non avia fallo, 24 come d’arco tricordo tre saette.
query.result: 22 Form and matter, joined and pure, 23 came forth to be that which had no fault, 24 as from a triple-corded bow three arrows.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
25 E come in vetro, in ambra o in cristallo 26 raggio resplende sì, che dal venire 27 a l’esser tutto non è intervallo,
28 così ’l triforme effetto del suo sire 29 ne l’esser suo raggiò insieme tutto 30 sanza distinzïone in essordire.
query.result:
25 And as in glass, in amber, or in crystal 26 a ray shines so that from the coming 27 to the being there is no interval,
28 thus the threefold effect of its sire 29 into its being shone all together 30 without distinction in beginning.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
46 Or sai tu dove e quando questi amori 47 furon creati e come: sì che spenti 48 nel tuo disïo già son tre ardori.
query.result: 46 Or do you know where and when these loves 47 were created and how: so that extinguished 48 in your desire already are three ardors.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
49 Né giugneriesi, numerando, al venti 50 sì tosto, come de li angeli parte 51 turbò il suggetto d’i vostri alimenti.
query.result: 49 Nor would you reach, in numbering, to twenty 50 so quickly, as of the angels a part 51 disturbed the subject of your nourishment.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
52 L’altra rimase, e cominciò quest’ arte 53 che tu discerni, con tanto diletto, 54 che mai da circüir non si diparte.
query.result: 52 The other remained, and began this art 53 that you discern, with so much delight, 54 that never from circling does it depart.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
55 Principio del cader fu il maladetto 56 superbir di colui che tu vedesti 57 da tutti i pesi del mondo costretto.
query.result: 55 Beginning of the fall was the accursed 56 pride of the one that you saw 57 by all the weights of the world constrained.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
58 Quelli che vedi qui furon modesti 59 a riconoscer sé da la bontate 60 che li avea fatti a tanto intender presti:
61 per che le viste lor furo essaltate 62 con grazia illuminante e con lor merto, 63 si c’hanno ferma e piena volontate;
64 e non voglio che dubbi, ma sia certo, 65 che ricever la grazia è meritorio 66 secondo che l’affetto l’è aperto.

Please translate each line literally into English.
67 Omai dintorno a questo consistorio 68 puoi contemplare assai, se le parole 69 mie son ricolte, sanz’ altro aiutorio.
query.result: 67 Now around this consistory 68 you can contemplate much, if my words are recalled, 69 without other aid.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
70 Ma perché ’n terra per le vostre scole 71 si legge che l’angelica natura 72 è tal, che ’ntende e si ricorda e vole,
73 ancor dirò, perché tu veggi pura 74 la verità che là giù si confonde, 75 equivocando in sì fatta lettura.
query.result:
70 But because on earth for your schools 71 it is read that the angelic nature 72 is such, that it understands and remembers and wills,
73 still I will say, because you see pure 74 the truth that down there is confused, 75 equivocating in such a reading.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
76 Queste sustanze, poi che fur gioconde 77 de la faccia di Dio, non volser viso 78 da essa, da cui nulla si nasconde:
79 però non hanno vedere interciso 80 da novo obietto, e però non bisogna 81 rememorar per concetto diviso;
82 sì che là giù, non dormendo, si sogna, 83 credendo e non credendo dicer vero; 84 ma ne l’uno è più colpa e più vergogna.

Please translate each line literally into English.
85 Voi non andate giù per un sentiero 86 filosofando: tanto vi trasporta 87 l’amor de l’apparenza e ’l suo pensiero!
88 E ancor questo qua sù si comporta 89 con men disdegno che quando è posposta 90 la divina Scrittura o quando è torta.
query.result:
85 You do not go down through a path 86 philosophizing: so much transports you 87 the love of appearance and its thought!
88 And also this up here behaves 89 with less disdain than when it is postponed 90 the divine Scripture or when it is twisted.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
91 Non vi si pensa quanto sangue costa 92 seminarla nel mondo e quanto piace 93 chi umilmente con essa s’accosta.
query.result: 91 It is not thought how much blood it costs 92 to sow it in the world and how much pleases 93 he who humbly approaches it with her.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
94 Per apparer ciascun s’ingegna e face 95 sue invenzioni; e quelle son trascorse 96 da’ predicanti e ’l Vangelio si tace.
query.result: 94 To appear, each one invents and makes 95 his inventions; and those are surpassed 96 by the preachers and the Gospel is silenced.

97 One says that the moon turned back 98 in the passion of Christ and interposed itself, 99 so that the light of the sun did not set down;
100 and lies, because the light hid itself 101 by itself: therefore to the Spaniards and the Indians 102 as to the Jews such an eclipse responded.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
103 Non ha Fiorenza tanti Lapi e Bindi 104 quante sì fatte favole per anno 105 in pergamo si gridan quinci e quindi:
106 sì che le pecorelle, che non sanno, 107 tornan del pasco pasciute di vento, 108 e non le scusa non veder lo danno.
query.result:
103 Florence does not have so many Lapi and Bindi 104 as many such fables per year 105 in parchment are shouted here and there:
106 so that the little sheep, who do not know, 107 return from the pasture grazed on wind, 108 and do not excuse not seeing the harm.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
115 Ora si va con motti e con iscede 116 a predicare, e pur che ben si rida, 117 gonfia il cappuccio e più non si richiede.
query.result: 115 Now one goes with jests and with tricks 116 to preach, and as long as one laughs well, 117 the hood swells and nothing more is required.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
118 Ma tale uccel nel becchetto s’annida, 119 che se ’l vulgo il vedesse, vederebbe 120 la perdonanza di ch’el si confida:
121 per cui tanta stoltezza in terra crebbe, 122 che, sanza prova d’alcun testimonio, 123 ad ogne promession si correrebbe.
query.result:
118 But such a bird nests in its little beak, 119 that if the common people saw it, they would see 120 the pardon of which it trusts:
121 for which so much foolishness grew on earth, 122 that, without proof of any testimony, 123 to every promise one would run.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
124 Di questo ingrassa il porco sant’ Antonio, 125 e altri assai che sono ancor più porci, 126 pagando di moneta sanza conio.
query.result: 124 From this Saint Anthony’s pig grows fat, 125 and others many who are even more pigs, 126 paying with money without coin.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
127 Ma perché siam digressi assai, ritorci 128 li occhi oramai verso la dritta strada, 129 sì che la via col tempo si raccorci.
query.result: 127 But because we have digressed much, turn 128 the eyes now towards the straight road, 129 so that the way with time may shorten.

130 This nature so greatly rejoices 131 in number, that never was speech 132 nor mortal concept that so far goes;
133 and if you look at what is revealed 134 by Daniel, you will see that in its thousands 135 a determined number is hidden.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
136 La prima luce, che tutta la raia, 137 per tanti modi in essa si recepe, 138 quanti son li splendori a chi s’appaia.
query.result: 136 The first light, that all the ray illuminates, 137 in so many ways in it is received, 138 as many as are the splendors to he who appears.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
139 Onde, però che a l’atto che concepe 140 segue l’affetto, d’amar la dolcezza 141 diversamente in essa ferve e tepe.
query.result: 139 Whence, therefore, that to the act which conceives 140 follows the affection, to love the sweetness 141 differently in it boils and grows warm.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
142 Vedi l’eccelso omai e la larghezza 143 de l’etterno valor, poscia che tanti 144 speculi fatti s’ha in che si spezza,
145 uno manendo in sé come davanti».
query.result:
142 See the highest now and the breadth 143 of the eternal power, after that so many 144 mirrors made have in which it breaks,
145 one remaining in itself as before.
